headline: Gunmen attack Benue villages, kill 17, abduct woman
summarized_story:
NO fewer than 17 people were reportedly killed in different villages of two local government areas in Benue State.
The killings occurred within the past three days in Agatu and Kastina-Ala LGAs respectively, local sources told our correspondent on Thursday evening.
“Not less than seven people in Mbatyula council ward were killed on Tuesday while Emmanuel Apever’s wife from Kenvanger was abducted to an unknown destination.
“In Tse Ate, three persons were killed and another two persons also killed at Saawua compound while three were reportedly killed in Tse Asaa.
All in Mbagbeentya community of Mbatyula council ward,” a resident alleged.

headline: It’s better to have fewer banks complying with law – Bawa
summarized_story:
The Chairman of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission, Abdulrasheed Bawa, has warned financial institutions against fraudulent election financing, foreign exchange malpractices and money laundering.
The EFCC boss said it had become necessary to put bankers on their toes, particularly as the 2023 general elections approached.
Speaking during an interactive session with managing directors of banks at the Lagos Zonal Command of the EFCC on Thursday, Bawa said, “At the EFCC, we want to place more emphasis on prevention and less emphasis on enforcement, which is investigation and prosecution.
“In addition, some of the issues we have identified include foreign exchange malpractices and fraudulent election financing.
“It is better to have fewer banks complying with the laws of the land than to have multiple banks not complying with the laws.”Copyright PUNCH.

headline: US: 49-year-old man arrested while allegedly attempting to bomb Capitol
summarized_story:
A 49-year-old man identified as Floyd Ray Roseberry from North Carolina was arrested and taken into custody on Thursday for allegedly attempting to bomb US Capitol Hill.
According to the report, FBI agents and members of the sheriff’s office in Cleveland County, North Carolina, went to his home, a representative for the sheriff’s office told News4.
US Capitol Police chief Tom Manger told reporters earlier this Thursday afternoon that the suspect’s motives were not certain.
“Just moments ago, Floyd Roy Roseberry from Grover, North Carolina, was taken into custody without incident,” Manger told reporters.
“We still have to search the vehicle and render the vehicle safe,” Manger said, adding that the process could take hours.

headline: Nigeria will not survive another 8 years under APC, Buhari aught to have resigned – Bamgbose
summarized_story:
The responses so far from the Presidency have shown that the insecurity in Nigeria has become hopeless and helpless,” Bamgbose, a senior lawyer, told DAILY POST.
President Buhari as usual, will condemn the attacks, assure Nigerians that he will deal with the insecurity, and finally meet with the security chiefs.

“Nigeria may not be able to survive another 8 years of APC government, I seriously doubt that.

headline: Nigeria will get new beginning – Osinbajo
summarized_story:
Vice President, Yemi Osinbajo, has said Nigeria is on course for a new beginning.
Osinbajo explained that it’s in the nature of God to create new beginnings; hence Nigeria is on course for one, despite all doubts.
The RCCG pastor stressed that a new beginning awaits Nigeria, despite those doubting if anything good would come out of the country.
According to Osinbajo: “Today, many men are saying the same about our nation Nigeria, even men of God, but this is the textbook case of how God works, He is set to give Nigeria a new beginning.
Weeping may endure for a night, but joy comes in the morning.”He also noted that a new beginning can only be achieved through the strength of God amid weakness.

headline: El-Zakzaky: Military task force bans planned protest by Shiites in Jos
summarized_story:
The military task force responsible for the maintenance of peace in Plateau State, code-named Operation Safe Haven (OPSH), has banned a planned protest by members of the proscribed Islamic Movement of Nigeria (IMN) otherwise known as Shiites in Jos, the Plateau State capital.
The OPSH said an intelligence report available to them indicates a planned protest by members of the aforementioned group.
The military task force equally said the protest which is planned to hold nationwide including Plateau State is scheduled for Friday 20th August, 2021.
It was also gathered that the protest, according to report, is due to the health challenges of its leader, Sheikh Ibrahim El-Zakzaky.
The military task force maintained that it is committed to the total restoration of peace on the Plateau and is working closely with the State Government, critical stakeholders such as traditional, religious leaders and law abiding citizens to achieve this mandate.

headline: Imo monarchs hold rally over insecurity
summarized_story:
Monarchs at Owerri zone in Imo State on Thursday held a peace rally against the insecurity that has bedevilled the state in the past eight months.
“Today the Ezes in Owerri zone came out for a peace rally and we moved round major junctions in Owerri zone to pour libation for peace.
We as monarchs will always support the government in power, regardless of how the person emerged.
The Ezes moved out for a peace rally and as you could see, the young and the old came out to join in this movement for peace.
We must, as citizens of Imo State, support our governor for the progress of the state.

headline: Ayade approves 100 per cent CONMESS for doctors
summarized_story:
Cross River State Governor Ben Ayade has approved the payment of 100 per cent Consolidated Medical Salary Structure (CONMESS) to doctors.
She urged doctors and other health personnel to reciprocate the gesture by being dedicated to duty.
The NMA Chairman in the state, Dr. Innocent Abang, said the visit was to appreciate Mrs. Ayade for her role in the salary structure approval.
ADVERTISEMENTAbang said approval of CONMESS for doctors would enhance hard work and effective service delivery in the health sector.
“This gesture will help to reduce the rate at which doctors leave the state in search of greener pastures.

headline: ‘Sultan’ in Edo sacrilegious, threat to peace, security, says govt
summarized_story:
Edo State Government has condemned the planned coronation of Idriss Addano as the ‘Sultan of Shuwa Arab of Edo State’.
It described the alleged move as sacrilegious and a threat to peace and security.
Secretary to Edo State Government (SSG) Osarodion Ogie on Thursday in an online statement, assured residents that a firm and a decisive action would be taken to prevent the actualisation of the illegal act.
“That it is a potential threat to the peace and security of Edo State, with the capacity to cause a breakdown of law and order, as citizens of the state are likely to be provoked by the obnoxious ceremony.
He said residents should be calm and law-abiding, as the Governor Godwin Obaseki administration was on top of the situation.

headline: Ganduje gets award on COVID-19
summarized_story:
Kano State Governor Abdullahi Ganduje has been honoured with the Most Outstanding Governor of the Federation in the Management of COVID-19.
The award was presented by Nigerian Guild of Medical Directors at its international conference in Abuja.
ADVERTISEMENTCommissioner for Health Dr. Aminu Ibrahim Tsanyawa, who represented the governor at the ceremony, said Kano State invested a lot of resources in fighting COVID-19, noting the governor was committed to improving healthcare delivery services.

headline: Outrage over plan to turban Sultan of Shuwa Arab of Edo
summarized_story:
From Tony Osauzo, BeninOutrage has greeted plans by Shuwa Arabs ethnic group from Borno, to crown Idris Adanno as the Sultan of Shuwa Arab of Edo State.
However, the Edo State Government has describing the purported move as sacrilegious and a threat to peace and security in the state.
In a statement, Secretary to the Edo State Government, Osarodion Ogie, assured citizens that firm and decisive action will be taken to prevent the actualization of the illegal and sacrilegious act.
“The Edo State Government has been inundated with complaints from indigenes and residents of the state over the purported move to embark on the coronation of one Idriss Addano as ‘Sultan of Shuwa Arab of Edo State’.
We should now have Oba and Sultan in Edo State?

headline: Atiku, Fayemi, others urge citizens to defend democracy
summarized_story:
Former Vice President Atiku Abubakar and Governor Kayode Fayemi of Ekiti have called on Nigerians to be vigilant and defend the nation’s democracy .
They made the call at the National Dialogue and Public Presentation of a book titled: “Remaking Nigeria: Sixty Years, Sixty Voices “ in Abuja, yesterday.
Abubakar, who was chairman of the occasion, called on Nigerians to defend democracy saying fixing or restructuring Nigeria would help in nation-building, adding that such would help to foster a sense of nationhood.
“When that happens, especially with fairness and justice, nation-building accelerates, however imperfectly; development and nation-building do not happen by themselves.
Onumah said that the book was the product of discussion on what needed to be done to rescue Nigeria.

headline: Mohammed Fawehinmi died of COVID-19-related complications –Family
summarized_story:
By Lukman OlabiyiThe family of the late Mohammed Fawehinmi has said he died of complications from COVID-19 infection.
Fawehinmi said the family could not immediately disclose the cause of the death because they wanted the information to be based on factual medical details.
“Today, however, we are in a position to inform you that our dear brother died from COVID-19-related complications.
The Mohammed, eldest son of the late legal icon and activist, Chief Gani Fawehinmi, died at about 9a.m.
Saheed Fawehinmi reiterated that interment would take place on Friday, August 27, at the Gani Fawehinmi family compound in Ondo, Ondo State, after a brief funeral service.

headline: PIA: Ijaw youths declare Buhari, Sylva, persona non grata in Niger Delta
summarized_story:
From Femi Folaranmi, YenagoaIjaw youths across six states of the Niger Delta region under the aegis of Ijaw Youths Council have declared President Muhamammdu Buhari who doubles as minister of petroleum and the Minister of State, Timipre Sylva, persona non grata over the Petroleum Industry Act (PIA).
It said the duo were no longer welcomed in the region for their role in the passage and signing of the Petroleum Industrial Bill (PIB) into law.
The group noted that despite the fact that the constitution guarantees the duo freedom of movement to any part of the country, they would be met with boos and jeers if they ventured into any part of the Niger Delta region for disregarding the plights and cries of the people of the region over the years.
According to him, a substantial percentage to the host communities would have helped to address the age long criminality.
“In the light of the forgoing, there’s no better time for the people of the Niger Delta region to intensify the struggle for resource control and self-determination.

headline: CNA: How Shagari Prevented Second Republic Lawmakers from Hijacking N’Assembly Bureaucracy
summarized_story:
By Deji Elumoye and Udora OrizuClerk to the National Assembly, Ojo Olatunde Amos, Thursday disclosed that late former President Shehu Shagari prevented members of the Second Republic National Assembly from making themselves members of the National Assembly Service Commission (NASC).
Amos made this known while playing host to a delegation of the Committee on Administration and Human Resources of Ghana Parliamentary Service Board at the National Assembly.
The Clerk explained how parliamentary bureaucracy was treated like an appendage of the Executive arm of government until year 2000 when the National Assembly Service Commission was created.
“When the proposal got to President Shehu Shagari, he asked the Members of the National Assembly to choose between being members of the National Assembly and members of the National Assembly Service Commission.

headline: Breaking: Buhari Okays Review of Grazing Reserves in 25 States
summarized_story:
By Deji ElumoyePresident Muhammadu Buhari Thursday gave a go ahead for the immediate review of Grazing Reserves in 25 out of the 36 states of the federation.
Among others, the committee had recommended the collection of field data on 368 Grazing Reserves across 25 states to assess encroachment and encroachers, stakeholder engagements and sensitization.
The number of the Grazing Reserves and States were deduced from considerations of existing security concerns and other pre-existing socio-economic conditions.
The President directed that the assignment be undertaken with dispatch to bring more understanding on the Grazing Reserves, and implementation.
The Committee was also expected to make recommendations for gazetting of ungazetted Grazing Reserves and create a data base of National Cattle Herders and ensure that Grazing Reserves were well communicated to all stakeholders.

headline: Buhari: Nigeria Will Be Well Secured Before I Leave Office
summarized_story:
By Deji ElumoyePresident Muhammadu Buhari has given an assurance that Nigeria will be well secured before he leaves office in May, 2023.
He emphasised that all within his power will be done to ensure that he does not leave the country in security crisis by the time his term of office ends.
The President gave the assurance Thursday while presiding over the National Security Council meeting at the State House, Abuja.
The National Security Adviser (NSA), Major-General Babagana Monguno (rtd), who disclosed the President’s position while speaking with newsmen after the meeting, said President Buhari also expressed his readiness to make more changes in the nation’s security architecture whenever the need arises.

headline: Fayemi: Govs Will Work with PIA Implementation Committee
summarized_story:
Says implementation committee chair assured NGF concerns raised will be addressed through amendmentInsists on adherence to constitutionBy Kingsley NwezehChairman of the Nigerian Governors’ Forum (NGF), Dr. Kayode Fayemi, said Thursday that the forum would work with the committee set up by the federal government to oversee the implementation of the Petroleum Industry Act (PIA) headed by Minister of State for Petroleum Resources, Mr. Timipre Sylva.
President Muhammadu Buhari signed the Petroleum Industry Bill passed by the National Assembly into law on Monday.
Speaking in an interview with Arise TV, the broadcast qq of THISDAY, Fayemi, who is also the Governor of Ekiti State, said while the governors were prepared to work with the committee, concerns regarding adherence to the constitution raised by the governors must be looked into.
He said Sylva had reached out to the forum to say that concerns raised by the forum would be addressed by way of amendment.

headline: Insecurity: Buhari Receives Briefing from CDS, Service Chiefs
summarized_story:
By Deji ElumoyePresident Muhammadu Buhari is being briefed by the Chief of Defence Staff (CDS), General Lucky Irabor and other security chiefs about recent developments associated with the security challenges facing the nation.
The President, who returned to Abuja last Friday after 18 days in London, during which he attended an education summit and did health checks, is receiving the first formal security briefing since he left the country last month.
President Buhari, at the meeting holding at the Conference Hall of the First Lady’s Office at the State House, is to be updated on security developments while plans to bring a decisive end to the challenges will be formulated.
The security forces have in the past few weeks taken the battle more robustly to insurgents, bandits, and all other criminals troubling the country, and they are now surrendering in droves.
Others attending the security meeting include Vice President Yemi Osinbajo, National Security Adviser (NSA), Major-General Babagana Monguno (rtd), the three Service chiefs and the Inspector General of Police, Usman Alkali Baba, among other top security personnel.

headline: BREAKING: Again, Nigerian Government Raises Petrol Pump Price
summarized_story:
The Petroleum Products Pricing Regulatory Agency has announced a new price band of N151.56 per litre for Premium Motor Spirit also known as petrol.
This new development was contained in a memo released by the Pipelines and Product Marketing Company and signed by D.O Abalaka.
The Nigerian Government had in March said the pump price of petrol would be determined by market forces, stating that how much Nigerians would pay would be largely determined by the international prices of crude oil.
The memo reads, “Please be informed that a new product price adjustment has been effected on our payment platform.
“To this end, the price of Premium Motor Spirit (PMS) is now one hundred and fifty-one naira, fifty-six kobo (N151.56k) per litre.

headline: Fire Guts Ebeano Supermarket In Abuja
summarized_story:
The popular Ebeano Supermarket, in Lokogoma area of Federal Capital Territory (FCT) Abuja, has been gutted by fire.
The inferno has caused confusion in the area as people were seen scampering for safety.
The cause of the fire and extent of damage cannot be ascertained as at the time of filing this report.
An eyewitness said the firefighters had arrived at the scene and making effort to put out the fire.
A group of prayer warriors was sighted praying outside the supermarket.

headline: Osinbajo: God is set to give Nigeria a new beginning
summarized_story:
Vice-President Yemi Osinbajo says despite the current challenges, God is working on putting Nigeria on a new path of growth and development.
AdvertisementOsinbajo said this while speaking at the 25th annual convention of the Redeemed Christian Church of God (RCCG) in the Americas.
With the convention themed “New Beginning”, the vice-president said it is in the nature of God to create new beginnings and Nigeria is on course, regardless of all doubts.
“Today, many men are saying the same about our nation Nigeria, even men of God, but this is the textbook case of how God works.
He is set to give Nigeria a new beginning,” Osinbajo said.

summarized_story:
Former President Olusegun Obasanjo says he believes Nigeria can experience sustainable development, if citizens unite to tackle the country’s challenges.

headline: Nigerian startup checks out of Afghanistan post Taliban takeover
summarized_story:
The central government was disbanded; Ashraf Ghani, the president of Afghanistan fled the scene unannounced, leaving what remained of his administration in the mercy of the Taliban.
More recently, Chekkit, a Nigerian authentication and product tracking startup, expanded to Afghanistan after landing a partnership with the Afghanistan Ministry of Health to help in combating the endemic counterfeit medicine products in the country.
Their exit wasn’t much of a decision as all their partners have been forced to exit the country.
Observers predict that with the Taliban in control, international trade will come to a standstill, leading to a surge in smuggling.
Though after the capital takeover, the Taliban announced that the war is now over, can the dust settle that easily?

headline: Businesses on edge as COVID-19 third wave peaks
summarized_story:
Businesses could be back on the brink of scrambling for strategies to escape the weight of an economy at standstill as the surge of COVID-19 third wave brings Nigeria closer to a possible lockdown decision.
The peak of Nigeria’s third wave of Covid-19 pandemic has begun, disease experts confirm, predicting that further rise in infections should be expected in the coming days as weak compliance with preventive measures persist.
Oyewale Tomori, a professor of virology in a chat with BusinessDay wondered why many Nigerians still do not believe the COVID-19 virus is circulating in the country despite rising numbers from only one-third of the 36 states.
Caution has been thrown to the wind since governments lifted lockdown and eased activities in many sectors of the economy.
Traders reported low sales, lack of cash on hand, and challenges with sourcing as significant problems facing their business.

headline: Olu Of Warri: ‘Missing Crown Won’t Stop Coronation’ – Chief Ariyo – Nigerian Observer
summarized_story:
Share FacebookTwitterStumbleuponLinkedInPinterestWarri – With just a few days to the coronation of the 21st Olu of Warri, the Egogo of Warri Kingdom, Chief Robinson Ariyo, has said that, The missing crowns reportedly stolen from the Olu’s palace, will not affect the coronation of the Olu designate, Omoba Tsola Emiko come 21st August, 2021.
Speaking to the Nigerian Observer yesterday at the Olu’s palace in Warri, Chief Ariyo ,who is also a member of the Olu Advisory Council, said , despite the ‘stolen crowns’ the coronation will go on as smoothly as planned.
Chief Ariyo, a development expert and legal practitioner, said,“The whole idea was to frustrate the crowning process, but that won’t stop the coronation.
“As at that time, the crowns were not yet stolen ; the crowns were stolen on the 1st of of April at about 3am.
While warning mischief makers and all those involved in the sacrilegious act (crown theft) , Chief Ariyo said,“A lot of people don’t understand the way nature works.

headline: Former Governor Arrested by EFCC – Nigerian Observer
summarized_story:
Share FacebookTwitterStumbleuponLinkedInPinterestABUJA – The former Governor of Abia State, Sen. Theodore Orji has been arrested by operatives of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCCC).
The former governor, who had for long been on the Commission’s watch list was reportedly driven back to the headquarters of the EFCC in Abuja.
The former governor who is currently senator and his sons, Chinedu and Ogbonna, has for months been under EFCC investigation for alleged misappropriation of public funds and money laundering.
The former governor is alleged to have received N500 million monthly as security vote for eight years as governor of Abia State between 2007 and 2015.
Other allegations against him concerned alleged mismanagement of N2 billion Ecological Fund and mismanagement of Sure-P funds.

headline: Coronation of Sultan in Edo: Enogie of Eyaen dissociates self, Rialto hotel from ceremony – Nigerian Observer
summarized_story:
Share FacebookTwitterStumbleuponLinkedInPinterestBENIN CITY – The Enogie of Eyaen commmunity and Chief Executive Officer of Rialto Hotel, Benin City, His Royal Highness, Dr Osazuwa Aiwerioghene Iduriase has dissociated himself and the hotel from a purported coronation ceremony of Sultan Idriss Adano as the Sultan of Shuwa Arabof Edo State.
The ceremony which has been trending in the social media for days now, was allegedly scheduled for August 21 and 22, 2021 at the Rialto Hotel.
In a statement, the Enogie said that the publication linking Rialto Hotel to the coronation ceremony was not only malicious, but also done in bad faith.
He said that those behind the said coronation ceremony actually approached him on the use of the hotel for a party which was later found to be coronation ceremony of the alleged Sultan.
He therefore warmed those planning to use Rialto Hotel for such ceremony to have a rethink.

summarized_story:

headline: Will government listen to our climate? By Enyene Vincent
summarized_story:
Climate change has been a major item of discuss among western nations and especially when they meet either at the United Nations General Assembly, G20 or G8.
Gas flaring introduces toxic pollutants such as sulfur dioxide into the atmosphere, which leads to environmental problems such as acid rain.
Also, gas flaring is a major source of greenhouse gases (GHG) contributing to global warming which accelerates the problem of climate change and harsh living conditions in the country.
To save the environment and humanity, the Nigerian government needs to stop postposing the doomsday and end gas flaring.
Earlier this year, Minister of state petroleum, Timipre Sylva said the federal government is now committed to eliminating gas flaring by 2025, after the government in 2016 extended the deadline to end gas flaring in 2020.

headline: COVID-19 cases plummet in Nigeria with eight new deaths
summarized_story:
COVID-19 cases plummeted in Nigeria on Thursday with 674 fresh cases reported across 16 states and the Federal Capital Territory (FCT), Abuja.
Eight new deaths were however recorded to take the overall deaths arising from the deadly virus to 2,244 in the third wave of the pandemic.
Nigeria posted 1,149 cases on Wednesday, the highest in a single day in 2021, but there was a sharp fall on Thursday with figures dropping sharply to 674.
This takes the total confirmed COVID-19 cases in Nigeria to 185,267 , with 167,923 survivors discharged so far according to the Nigerian Centre for Disease Control, NCDC.
In Thursday infections, Lagos logged on 355 new cases, a drop from the 680 cases it posted the previous day, while Rivers which came second reported 87 cases, a fall from the 157 cases it raked in on Wednesday.

headline: BREAKING: Buhari Approves Review Of 368 Grazing Sites In 25 States
summarized_story:
President Muhammadu Buhari has endorsed the committee’s recommendations after it examined 368 grazing sites in Nigeria.
The reserves include 25 states, and the evaluation will establish the extent to which they have been encroached upon.

The committee recommended gathering field data on the 368 reserves in order to assess encroachers, as well as stakeholder participation and sensitization.
The number of reserves and states was calculated based on existing security concerns and other pre-existing socioeconomic variables.

The procession which started from Trade Fair on the popular Kano road, passed through NNPC, to Mahmud Gimi road and ended at Madam Karo.

Secondus, who arrived the former president’s residence in company of his entourage around 12.19pm went straight into the meeting.

A crack had emerged in the PDP National Working Committee (NWC) two weeks ago, after the resignation of some officials and calls for Secondus’ resignation by some NWC members became more emboldened.

headline: Taliban ‘Intensifying’ Search For Afghans Who Helped US – UN
summarized_story:
The Taliban is intensifying a search for people who worked with US and NATO forces, a confidential United Nations document says, despite the militants vowing no revenge against opponents.
The report — provided by the UN’s threat-assessment consultants and seen by AFP — says the group has “priority lists” of individuals it wants to arrest.
Most at risk are people who had central roles in the Afghan military, police and intelligence units, according to document.
The Taliban have been conducting “targeted door-to-door visits” of individuals they want to apprehend and their family members, the report says.
The report says the militants are “rapidly recruiting” new informers to collaborate with the Taliban regime and are expanding their lists of targets by contacting mosques and money brokers.

headline: AfDB Partners Ghana to launch $7.4m Institutional Support Project
summarized_story:
The Manager at the Resource Mobilization and Economic Relations Division of the Finance Ministry at the project launch, Emmanuel Fordjour, thanked the African Development Bank for supporting the government.
The African Development Bank Group and the Ministry of Finance in Ghana have launched a $7.4 million Institutional Support Project to strengthen domestic revenue mobilization and Debt Management Capacity.
The African Development Bank Country Manager for Ghana, Eyerusalem Fasika, emphasized the importance of the project to Ghana’s medium-term development objectives and the Finance Ministry’s 2018-2021 strategic plan.
The project complements current efforts to strengthen domestic resource mobilization in Ghana, following the challenges in revenue mobilization due to supply disruptions caused by the Covid-19 pandemic.
The project will help the country return to prudent debt levels through improved debt management capacity and a sustainable cash flow to smooth public spending.
